result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Michael Wertschnig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Michael Wertschnig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven Michael Wertschnig was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Steven Michael Wertschnig was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell March 2, 2016 - Amend JOC to find Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.


-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-If revoked prison sentence will run consecutive.
-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: to Count 2

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy and treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:24 p.m.  Set for SEH.  ADA Nieskes recites the State's recommendation for Sentencing.  Attorney Harrelson makes argument.  DE makes statement.  Crt Orders:

Ct. 1 in 14CF219
DE sentenced to 3 years 6 Months
- 1 year 6 months of I/C and 2 years probation with conditions - stayed with 3 years probation with conditions:
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy and treatment
- Ct. 1 Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for DNA Surcharge 
- DE will pay court costs through the DOC

Ct. 2 in 14CF219
DE sentenced to 3 years 6 Months
- 1 year 6 months of I/C and 2 years probation with conditions - stayed with 3 years probation to run concurrent to the 3 year probation on Ct. 1 with these conditions:
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy and treatment
- Ct. 2 Court costs of $268.00  
- DE will pay court costs through the DOC

- If probation is revoked, prison sentences will run consecutive and consecutive to any E/S revocation sentence
- Credit for 74 days if revoked
- DE to report to probation within 24 hours of SEH
- Bail will remain in effect until DE reports to probation and then vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Sentencing hearing at 08-04-2015 01:15 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared from jail. Includes 14CF219 and 15CF249. Counsel confirms DEF will enter plea today.  ADA Nieskes will provide PSI to Court from 05CF459, at request of Court, and possibly revocation order and warrant packet. Court reviews consequences of felony conviction with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties for Count One (Maintaining a Drug Residence) and Count Two (Possession of Meth) in case 14CF219, def pleads Guilty to both Counts. Count 3 dismissed in case 14CF219; case 15CF249 is dismissed. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudicates def guilty of counts one and two. Bond continues. Adjourned 1:30 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 07-22-2015 01:00 pm

Jury intructions, Proposed Verdict Forms and Motions by the FPT on 07/22/2015.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:47 a.m. lw  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Court called at 10:17 a.m.  Includes 15CF249 (arraignment) & 14CF219 (STC). DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on 15CF249. Speedy trial is waived.  Set out for STC.   Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:21 a.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:17 a.m.  Includes case 14CF219 (STC) & 15CF249 (PH) S/T of Lt. Hutton of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office.   Direct by ADA Hahn.  DE is identified by Lt. Hutton.  Cross by Attorney Harrelson.  State's Ex. 1 - (Bail Bond) O/R.  Attorney Harrelson makes argument.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set 15CF249 out for arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:25 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

*AMENDED* 

INCLUDES CASE 15CF249 & 14CF219

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L. Hahn, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Steven Michael Wertschnig appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:18 a.m. ADA Hahn agrues bond.  State is asking for a cash bond.  Attorney Harrelson makes an argument.  Court amends to a cash bond.  Court adjourned at 10:24 a.m. lw  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Michael Wertschnig
Current: 1739 112th Street, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 1800 Aspen Drive #107, Hudson, WI 54016 
per Defendant's bond. eif

*AMENDED*

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- Report every Saturday beginning the very next Saturday the DE is released up until the Jury Trial before 5:00pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO PHYSICAL CONTACT whatsoever with the following locations, the 1800 block of Aspen Drive, Hudson WI 54016.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DE to reside with Mark Holmquist at 1739 112th Street, New Richmond WI 54017.  If DE is no longer able to reside at the following residence he should turn himself in to the St. Croix County Jail.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
